channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn supporters leave 'anti-Semitic' jibes on Go Fund Me page raising cash to defend him
item.description: Jeremy Corbyn supporters have been accused of leaving 'anti-Semitic' comments on a Go Fund Me campaign, set up Carole Morgan, by the charity Campaign Against Antisemitism.

item.title: Boris Johnson plans calorie labels on alcohol and restaurant meals
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Drinkers could soon be told the number of calories in their favourite tipple while in the pub or at a restaurant under new guidelines being considered by the government.

item.title: Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi's former-fiancée moves into the office below his in Kensington
item.description: Dara Huang, who has a three-year-old-son with the property developer, relocated her London office from Clerkenwell to the Kensington building where Eduardo Mapelli Mozzi bases his company.

item.title: New £79.5m yacht for the super wealthy comes with a sub and two helicopters
item.description: Among the many 'toys' on board are two snow-scooters, four jet-skis, a diving centre with its own decompression chamber and two helicopters in a below-deck hangar.

item.title: Wealthy residents of Richmond in south-west London pay for 'private police force'
item.description: Questions over Richmond's 'private police force' and their heavy-handedness have arisen after a video (pictured) on social media was shared showing a 'guard' grabbing a younger's scooter.

item.title: Man who smuggled Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn out of Japan talks
item.description: Michael Taylor, 59, and his son Peter are currently being held in U.S. federal custody pending an extradition request from Japan, where they are charged in Ghosn's brazen December escape.

item.title: Grade II-listed WI college to be shut and sold after 72 years
item.description: For more than 70 years, it has been the jewel in the crown of the Women's Institute - an educational retreat where the ladies of middle England could learn new skills or finesse old ones.

item.title: Boris Johnson orders civil servants to return to their desks by end of next week
item.description: Boris Johnson has told mandarins to tear up the 'work from home' guidance which has been in place since March and start getting officials back to the office from the end of next week.

item.title: Katie Price's dog breeders say nobody to blame for puppy death
item.description: JRC Bullies explained how they're 'heartbroken' for the family after the French bulldog passed away when it got stuck under an electric armchair.

item.title: Spray that costs pennies and kills viruses instantly could be a simple solution to Covid nightmare
item.description: Scientists, doctors and healthcare experts want to know why hypochlorous acid it is not being deployed in this country more widely.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK 'will be dealing with outbreaks next summer'
item.description: The Prime Minister suggested masks could remain compulsory in shops for at least a year, but declined to put a precise time scale on the new rules on coverings.

item.title: The Corrs' guitarist Jim Corr's anti-mask comments go viral
item.description: The 55-year-old Irish musician has been railing against new restrictions on the day face masks became compulsory in shops across England.

item.title: Female Irish soldier who joined ISIS charged with terrorism
item.description: Lisa Smith, 38, from County Louth, has been charged with membership of an unlawful organisation under 2005 terror legislation.

item.title: Great Ormond St Hospital blasted over end of life care of girl, 9
item.description: Ms Justice Russell today blasted Great Ormond St Hospital after its Ethics Committee decided to move a nine-year-old girl onto a palliative treatment offering end of life support without telling her family.

item.title: Charlize Theron 'insulted' by extra Italian Job driving training
item.description: Charlize Theron, pictured, said she was told she must do a six-week driving course ahead of starring in the remake of The Italian Job in 2003. Though, she said she was very proud of her driving skills.

item.title: Coroner 'wrong to narrow scope of Novichok victim's inquest'
item.description: Judges ruled that a coroner wrongly narrowed the scope of an inquest into the death of Dawn Sturgess. The mother died in hospital after handling a perfume bottle containing chemical poison in 2018.

item.title: 76% aged 16 to 24 don't know county where Shakespeare born
item.description: A survey concludes that young Britons - aka Generation Z - need to reconnect with their nation after finding that they didn't know the answers to basic geography questions.

item.title: Gordon Ramsay forgets to social distance with restaurant staff
item.description: The Michelin-starred chef, 53, was seen smiling as he stood with 10 other people after having a seafood dinner at Esplanada Furnas in Ericeira, Portugal, on Monday.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'joked about punching Amber Heard in the face'
item.description: iO Tillett Wright, who was Heard's best man in February 2015, claimed he already knew Depp was 'hitting' her when the alleged comment was made.

item.title: Tool colorizes and transforms grainy black and white photos
item.description: The technology, released online by US genealogy firm MyHeritage, dramatically improves the resolution of old photographs and also colorises them and claims to the best in the world.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn goes shopping without a face covering
item.description: The former Labour leader, 71, was spotted inside an Italian deli in Islington, North London without a mask today, risking a £100 spot fine under the new law.

item.title: Small businesses 'can't continue to give NHS staff discounts'
item.description: Cheshire-based Caroline Constable, who runs the digital marketing consultancy Clink Creative, revealed she has had 'numerous requests' from frontline workers asking for 'care packages''.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Claims she's living with German family
item.description: The Portuguese woman claims she saw a teenage girl with Madeleine's distinctive blemish in her right eye outside a supermarket in Gale near Albufeira.

item.title: Love Island's Dr Alex George reveals his brother Llŷr has died following mental health battle
item.description: The former Love Island star, 30, took to Instagram on Friday to share the tragic news with fans as he shared snap with his brother, along with an emotional tribute.

item.title: Coronavirus England: People in poor areas twice as likely to die
item.description: People living in the poorest areas of the country, which are typically inner city boroughs in London, Birmingham and the north of England, have suffered an average of almost 140 Covid deaths per 100,000.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein: New victim says pedophile raped her aged 17
item.description: A new Epstein accuser has broken her silence to reveal how the pedophile raped her and took her virginity when she was 17 in summer of 2015, she told DailyMail.com in an exclusive interview.

item.title: Harrowing dashcam video shows policeman finding PC Harper's shredded body armour
item.description: WARNING: DISTRESSING CONTENT: PC Andrew Harper was dragged to death along a country lane by his feet in Berkshire for over a mile last August.

item.title: Anti-maskers provoke shop staff by flouting restrictions on day 1
item.description: People are now required by law to wear face masks in shops, stations, banks and post offices across England, with police encouraging businesses to enforce the new policy.

item.title: Amber Heard 'bled' while Johnny Depp 'urinated' on furniture
item.description: In her written witness statement presented to the court today Heard's friend said the 'Australia incident' was the first time she was 'scared for Heard's life.'

item.title: Police hunt man who fled without paying for 5-hour £300 tattoo
item.description: Police are on the hunt for a man who fled Puzzle tattoo studio in Hyson Green, Nottingham, without paying for a £300 artwork showing a lion, a crown and an unfinished flower.

item.title: Mind-blowing hidden purposes of everyday objects revealed
item.description: Bored Panda has revealed the purpose behind the unusual features spotted on everyday items around the world, including the bobble on hats and the seemingly useless tiny pocket on jeans.

item.title: Why COVID-19 is killing U.S. diabetes patients at...
item.description: Nearly 40 percent of Americans who died of coronavirus in the US had diabetes, a CDC analysis of data on 15 states has revealed. Doctors worry the virus itself could lead to new diabetes cases.

item.title: Humans develop motor skills later than other primates
item.description: Although 'a big brain equals great dexterity', humans have to wait relatively longer to develop full dexterity, allowing us to tie shoelaces, hold a pen or use cutlery.

item.title: Social distancing may have saved Jews from typhus in WWII
item.description: Nazi forces ultimately crammed more than 460,00 people into the 1.3 square mile area of the Ghetto, which was created in Occupied Poland in late 1940.

item.title: RSC warns theatres won't be able to support diverse communities
item.description: Boris Johnson last week said live indoor theatre and concerts in the UK can resume with socially-distanced audiences from August 1, subject to pilots.

item.title: BBC Panorama PPE documentary DID breach editorial standards
item.description: The investigation, titled 'Has The Government Failed The NHS?', included an interview with former Labour candidate Dr Sonia Adesara.

item.title: Man denies smuggling 39 Vietnamese migrants who died into UK
item.description: An alleged human trafficker has denied that he helped smuggle 39 Vietnamese migrants into the UK who died in the back of a refrigerated lorry.

item.title: Man's girlfriend dies in hospital giving birth to their daughter
item.description: Patrick Ratcliffe, 22, from Stoke-on-Trent, was not allowed to stay at the hospital as his girlfriend had not gone into active labour when she arrived.

item.title: Man jailed for attacking Guardian columnist Owen Jones
item.description: James Healy admitted assaulting the Guardian columnist in August last year but denied being motivated by Mr Jones's sexuality or political campaigning.

item.title: Think tank suggests capital gains tax is applied to all homes
item.description: The Social Market Foundation is proposing a 10 per cent tax on the gain made from a rise in house prices when a property is sold, or when it is inherited after the owner's death.

item.title: Spain COULD be suffering a second wave of coronavirus, say health chiefs
item.description: France's prime minister Jean Castex said today that 'we strongly encourage French citizens to avoid' going to Catalonia, which has seen nearly 8,000 new cases in two weeks.

item.title: Barclays chief nicknamed himself 'pooper scooper' to exec
item.description: The comments from Stephen Jones, pictured, came during a 2008 phone call that was played in the High Court in London today, in which he said he became Roger Jenkins' 'personal flunky'.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Average daily cases rising for a WEEK
item.description: Office for National Statistics data based on population testing in England estimate that daily infections have risen from 1,700 to 2,800 in the space of seven days.

item.title: NASA to study light from newborn stars with giant balloon
item.description: Once in the stratosphere ASTHROS will observe wavelengths that aren't currently visible from the ground in an effort to measure the motion and speed of gas around newly-formed stars.

item.title: Care home outbreaks of Covid-like illnesses highest for a month
item.description: In the week from July 13 to 19 there were 145 outbreaks of 'acute respiratory infections' in homes across England - which made up 60 per cent of the country's total figure.

item.title: Coronavirus US: 'Normality may be possible AFTER vaccine'
item.description: Dr Anthony Fauci said on Thursday during an interview with CNN that many companies researching coronavirus vaccines have promised hundreds of million of doses by 2021.

item.title: UK Weather: More rain and thunder is due on wet weekend
item.description: The UK is set for a weekend of heavy rain and thunder as a band of clouds move across southern England and brings downpours to Northern Ireland, Scotland and western Wales.

item.title: Statue of Christopher Columbus is removed in Chicago's Grant Park
item.description: Two statues of Christopher Columbus in Chicago were removed under cover of darkness in the early hours of this morning after drawing chaotic protests during a wave of violence in the city.

item.title: Wall Street Journal vows not to 'wilt under cancel culture pressure' after staffers' protest letter
item.description: The Wall Street Journal - which is owned by Rupert Murdoch's News Corp - opinion section issued a scathing rebuttal late Thursday to a letter signed by 280 of the paper's staffers.

item.title: Facebook 'ignored racial bias research,' whistleblowers say
item.description: In mid-2019, researchers for Facebook-owned Instagram found that black people were 50 per cent more likely to have their accounts disabled by the new moderation system than white people.

item.title: Labour MP Nadia Whittom, 24, launches attack on free speech
item.description: The MP for Nottingham East wrote a column for The Independent published yesterday, titled: 'The only way to avoid hysteria about trans rights is to ground the debate in real life experiences'.

item.title: UK property developer, 20, shares how she finds run down properties to do up
item.description: Summer Newman, 20, from Rugby, who owns a property developing business with her boyfriend Matt Mellor, 23, took to TikTok to share her tips for finding properties with developing potential.

item.title: Think tank suggests fully-paid 4-day working week for UK
item.description: Left-wing think tank Autonomy say a state-funded four-day week scheme, in which the government covers the cost of the lost fifth day, would encourage Britons to get out and spend.

item.title: Girl, 14, raped by coronavirus patient at Delhi quarantine centre
item.description: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a coronavirus patient at the Sardar Patel Covid Care Centre in southern Delhi while his friend allegedly stood guard and filmed the attack on a mobile phone.

item.title: Europe on the brink of a second wave?
item.description: Berlin's health minister Dilek Kalayci said today that those coming back from high-risk countries should be tested and those returning from non-risk countries will also have the option.

item.title: Police run away from missile-hurling yobs in bodycam footage
item.description: Footage released by the Metropolitan Police showed officers running for safety as angry crowds pelted them with bottles and other objects during an illegal rave at an estate in Brixton on June 25.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper death: Widow tells of shock over verdict
item.description: PC Andrew Harper, 28, had tried to stop the thieves stealing a quad bike and his ankles were lassoed by the trailing loading strap as the teenagers tried to escape in Sulhamstead, Berkshire.

item.title: FEMAIL reveals the stunning homes for sale that include gyms
item.description: If you're dreaming of an alternative to sharing machines and pools with others, these stunning properties currently on the market boast facilities bound to impress even the keenest of gym bunnies.

item.title: 50s and 60s photos show UK holidaymakers at Butlin's camps
item.description: The nostalgia-inducing images capture crowds of holidaymakers flocking to Blackpool's beaches and families enjoying the sun at Butlin's first holiday camp in Skegness, which opened in 1936.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Interactive map shows deaths by postcode
item.description: The map, which uses Office for National Statistics data, shows that one in 20 fatalities in the capital last month were caused by Covid-19. In the North West one in eight were Covid-related.

item.title: Imperial College vaccine's second round trials on 200 humans
item.description: The vaccine is made of genetic material (RNA) from the coronavirus and forces the body to replicate spikes found on the outside of the virus, spurring the immune system into action.

item.title: Boris's junk food ad ban a 'slap in the face' for food industry' after coronavirus heroics
item.description: Producers and advertising industry figures warned that jobs could be at risk as it as revealed Boris Johnson is considering taking drastic steps to curb the UK's obesity problem.

item.title: Statue of slave owner to be removed from Cardiff City Hall
item.description: Workers began to cover the statue of Sir Thomas Picton today after Cardiff Council said his 'abhorrent' behaviour' meant he was 'not deserving of a place in the Heroes of Wales collection'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Minister hints GLOVES may need to be worn
item.description: The PM said he believes the UK will be 'well past' coronavirus by the middle of next year, but warned of 'tough times' ahead. He refused to put a timescale on how long Britons would have to wear masks.

item.title: Young male dolphins have 'wingmen' to help them find a mate
item.description: US researchers studied records of dolphin activity in Western Australia's Shark Bay spanning some 30 years, looking at the groupings youngsters formed.

item.title: Search for Doncaster man who punched dog in face three times
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Footage of the violent attack, which reportedly happened in Edlington, Doncaster, South Yorkshire, has been shared hundreds of times on social media.

item.title: Inside Madonna's $6m 18th-century Lisbon mansion
item.description: The pop legend, 61, has been giving fans a glimpse of the sensational property, which boasts a guesthouse, four bedrooms and seven bathrooms, on her Instagram.

item.title: Mother reunited with baby after he was stolen and sold in China
item.description: Police footage shows the mother breaking down in tears when she met her baby six days after he was stolen from her bedside in Yunnan province, southern China, earlier this month.

item.title: Man walks down Oxford Street wearing JUST face mask 'G-string'
item.description: Masks are now compulsory in shops up and down the country, but one man made a mockery of the new rules today by fashioning one into a thong and strutting through the capital in the nude.

item.title: Great Dane imitates bucking bronco as he watches TV
item.description: Hilarious footage shows Pluto the Great Dane jumping up and down while watching a rodeo on television. Owner Kelsey Tarasoff took the video at her home in Cranbrook, British Columbia, Canada.

item.title: Russia says US and UK ALSO developing secret space weapons
item.description: Moscow issued its response earlier today after being furiously condemned by the United States Space Command for a 'concerning' act that they said had threatened peace in space.

item.title: MP Charlie Elphicke 'not on trial for being terrible husband'
item.description: Former Tory MP for Dover Charlie Elphicke denies three allegations of sexual assault against two women in 2007 and 2016. He is on trial at Southwark Crown Court in London.

item.title: Fans enjoy rabbit's 'soothing' chewing sound in ASMR video
item.description: The four-year-old female angora rabbit, nicknamed 'Big Bear', is seen in trending footage dressed in different outfits while chomping on fruit and vegetables. It has nearly one million followers.

item.title: Confusion and anger on day one of new face mask law
item.description: Some McDonald's customers were left disappointed when they were turned away from restaurants in Liverpool and Chelmsford, Essex, for not wearing masks as new rules start today.

item.title: Police bodycam footage shows PC Andrew Harper killers' arrest
item.description: The three-and-a-half minute video shows officers taking the details of Henry Long and Albert Bowers before the pair are remanded in custody.

item.title: Man, 22, who posed as schoolboy to rape girl, 13, avoids jail
item.description: Jenny Yoksha, from Manchester, was 13 when she was tricked into losing her virginity in 2009. Michael Thornton, 22, pretended to be a 16-year-old schoolboy when groomed the naive teen.

item.title: Megan Barton Hanson wears slinky red cocktail dress in photo
item.description: The Love Island star, 26, looked incredible as she slipped into a red silk cocktail dress in an Instagram snap which she posted on Friday.

item.title: Love Island's Laura Anderson cuts a stylish figure as she catches up with pal Dr Alex George
item.description: The pair became firm pals during their appearance on 2018's instalment of Love Island, which saw Laura, 31, finish second with then beau Paul Knopp.

item.title: North Carolina professor found dead weeks after backlash
item.description: Police yesterday found the body of a North Carolina professor who announced his early retirement amid backlash for a tweet where he referred to Gov. Roy Cooper as 'Massa Cooper'.

item.title: Stylist shows how Carrie Symonds has transformed wardrobe
item.description: Celebrity stylist Susie Hasler has revealed how Carrie Symonds, 31, has ditched her wellington boots and paisley print for a sophisticated First Lady of Britain look in the past year.

item.title: Married police officer sacked after sending genitals photo
item.description: PC Toby Rideout claimed the woman initiated a kiss at a road accident in Bristol and he gave her his number and Facebook name. He only told his superiors of the affair when she threatened to do so.

item.title: CCTV shows Andrew Harper's killers looking for items to steal
item.description: Henry Long, Albert Bowers and Jessie Cole had been filmed on CCTV looking for something to steal from a property in Woolley, Oxfordshire - before the horrifying killing of PC Harper 18 miles away.

item.title: Wayne and Coleen Rooney add access road to £20m mansion
item.description: Work on the huge six-bedroom country house and 40-acre estate in Knutsford, Cheshire stopped in April due to concerns around coronavirus

item.title: Boy, 12, arrested at gunpoint by police carried TOY PISTOL
item.description: Kai Agyepond, 12, was led out of his Camden home in handcuffs and placed into the back of a police car while up to 25 Met police officers and sniffer dogs searched for a weapon.

item.title: Indonesian prisoner gets 17 lashes for betting in Aceh region
item.description: The Aceh Islamic Sharia Court administered 17 lashes for the man who had been found guilty of gambling in Lhokseumawe City.

item.title: Erdogan leads first Friday prayers at Istanbul's Hagia Sophia
item.description: The Friday prayers, which are the first in 86 years at the structure, saw thousands of worshippers travel across Turkey to join today's ceremony.

item.title: Bear cub with bucket stuck on his head rescued from tree
item.description: The black bear had been abandoned by his mother and was spotted hiding up a tree by a Canadian lake. Trevor Buchmann, 46, and Greg Elder rescued the cub at Kenogami Lake, in Ontario.

item.title: London is third most-monitored city in the world
item.description: The UK capital has nearly 630,000 surveillance cameras, or 67 cameras for every 1,000 people - a higher level of monitoring than in Beijing, Shanghai or Hong Kong.

item.title: Jacqueline Jossa enjoys date with Dan Osborne after confession
item.description: The revelation came after the former EastEnders star, 27, enjoyed a date night with husband Dan Osborne on Thursday after he finally confessed to cheating on her.

item.title: Reddit users reveal the things they learned embarrassingly late
item.description: Jaw-dropping confessions of ignorance by Reddit users from around the world, collated by Bored Panda, include not knowing gherkins are cucumbers or that Mexico is in North America.

item.title: Emily Maitlis was texted by Dominic Cummings after her Newsnight rant over his lockdown trip
item.description: Emily Maitlis, 49, was found to have violated the BBC's impartiality guidelines following her monologue on Mr Cummings's trip to Barnard Castle in Durham.

item.title: The three killers of PC Andrew Harper who laughed during trial
item.description: Henry Long, 19, and his passengers Jessie Cole and Albert Bowers, both 18, are facing years in jail for manslaughter over the death of PC Andrew Harper in Berkshire.

item.title: Colourised 1908 Olympic pictures released to celebrate Games
item.description: The image is one of a series of iconic photos from former Olympics transformed into colour to capture the excitement of the events. Tokyo 2020's opening ceremony should have taken place tonight.

item.title: Efforts to save 15ft shark stranded on UK beach fails when it refuses to be guided back out to sea
item.description: Lifeboat crews and rescue specialists attempted to guide the basking shark away from the shore at Filey, North Yorkshire, but after struggling to swim it became restranded and had to be put down.

item.title: Coot stands on duck's back to hitch a ride around park pond
item.description: A coot was filmed standing on the back of a swimming duck by Ian Baddiley in Shipley Country Park, Derbyshire, on July 23. Mr Baddiley was feeding the ducks with his son when they noticed the two birds.

item.title: Uncle dashes out of his house STARK NAKED to chase 'van driver abducting his niece'
item.description: Nathan Murphy, 29, was caught on CCTV running into the street naked in North Ormesby, Middlesborough. He woke up in a panic after his family shouted his niece Lucy had been abducted.

item.title: Andrew Harper jury had police protection amid intimidation fears
item.description: The PC Andrew Harper case at London's Old Bailey was dogged by alleged attempts to 'frustrate' the investigation and fears over jury nobbling, it can now be reported.

item.title: Love Island's Malin Andersson wears mustard yellow bikini
item.description: The Love Island star, 27, flaunted her amazing figure in a mustard bikini on Instagram on Friday while continuing to promote body confidence.

item.title: Man buys his late father's police car after spotting it on eBay
item.description: Greg Barnett, from Co. Durham, spotted his late father's Vauxhall Victor on eBay more than 10 years after he had last seen it. His father used it when training officers for Durham Constabulary.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Fury as Portugal STAYS on quarantine list
item.description: Ministers updated a list of nations from which arrivals would be exempt from 14-day isolation this afternoon but the popular holiday destination was still missing from it.

item.title: Green Party takes control of Brighton and Hove Council
item.description: The change in political control in Brighton comes after Labour councillor Kate Knight quit when a series of allegedly anti-Semetic Facebook posts were unearthed.

item.title: Woman shares £1,947 budget children's bedroom transformation
item.description: Emma Louise Russell, 27, from Doncaster, told Femail she did a total refurbishment on her children's bedroom with her partner Titch, 30, after plans for an extension were delayed by Covid-19.

item.title: Chinese sperm bank urges males to 'actively make donations'
item.description: The fertility clinic in Yunnan province said that they were struggling to help wannabe parents after the number of volunteers dropped drastically due to the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Cosmo the Frankenbull bull calf will produce 75% male offspring
item.description: The bull, called Cosmo, was born in April at University of California Davis and weighed around 110 pounds and is believed to be perfectly healthy.

item.title: Skydive murder plot wife's new hunky Royal Marine lover
item.description: Victoria Cilliers, 44, looked blissfully happy as she strolled along the streets of Amesbury, Wiltshire, with Simon Goodman, 49, a Royal Marines Commando whom she has known for nine years.

item.title: Mediterranean Sea was 3.6°F hotter during the Roman Empire, study claims
item.description: The Empire coincided with a 500-year period, from AD 1 to AD 500, that was the warmest period of the last 2,000 years in the almost completely land-locked sea.

item.title: Hammer blow to High Street: Britons are buying less and spending less
item.description: All UK in-store sales are 33 per cent down on pre-lockdown levels with clothes store sales slumping 50 per cent in the same period, according to the Office for National Statistics.

item.title: Coronavirus can infect people 26 FEET away in cold moving air, finds study
item.description: Researchers from the Helmholtz Centre for Infection Research recreated a high-profile Covid-19 outbreak at a food factory in Germany and found conditions were ideal for infection.

item.title: Greater Manchester Police branded 'inept' by Labour MP after racers brought M60 to a grinding halt
item.description: Andrew Gwynne blasted the Greater Manchester Police after the M60 motorway was brought to a complete standstill on Sunday. Mr Gwynne said event was advertised on Facebook beforehand.

item.title: 23andMe study reveals how the dark history of the transatlantic slave trade shaped black genetics
item.description: A new DNA study published Thursday sheds fresh light on how the horrors of the transatlantic slave trade - including rape and deaths en route to the Americas - have shaped black genetics.

item.title: Toddler is caught swinging from the chandelier in her bedroom in hilarious nanny cam footage
item.description: Three-year-old Elise was caught swinging on the chandelier in her bedroom in Edgewater, Maryland. Nanny cam footage shows the toddler climb her bed frame to reach the ceiling light.

item.title: Boris Johnson slams 'nuts anti-vaxxers' as he urges 'everybody' to get a flu jab before winter
item.description: When discussing opponents of vaccinations such as the MMR jab, the Prime Minister said: 'They are nuts.' He added that getting a flu jab could help to protect the NHS in the event of a second wave.

item.title: Boris Johnson reveals he has lost more than a STONE in weight after his coronavirus scare
item.description: The Prime Minister urged Brits to shed the pounds, with studies showing that being overweight makes the illness far worse. He spent a week in intensive care after contracting coronavirus.

item.title: The ISIS 'Beatles' admit torturing US hostage James Foley
item.description: Alexanda Kotey and El Shafee Elsheikh, who are both in U.S. military custody in Iraq, have given new details about the captivity of Western hostages in Syria

item.title: Family who spend £550 a month on snacks save £1,000 and drop 2st by cutting out convenience food
item.description: Catering assistant Claire Thornstone, her caretaker husband Jason, Harley, 9, Amelia, 6, from Pontefract, West Yorkshire, appeared on the first episode of Thursday night's ITV Eat, Shop Save.

item.title: New 'vague' Scots hate crime law 'could stifle free speech'
item.description: Thomas Ross QC warned it would be 'impossible' for Scots to know if they had committed a crime, which could lead to debate on controversial subjects being stifled.

item.title: Up to 500 jobs are at risk at online retailer ASOS after it announced restructuring of the business
item.description: An email from chief executive Nick Beighton to staff insists the proposed move 'is not an impact of Covid-19' and that bosses are 'returning to our pre-pandemic plan of re-shaping our organisation'.

item.title: Burglaries expected to rise this summer so protect your home
item.description: Whilst people have been spending more time at home in lockdown, burglaries have been significantly reduced - but this could all change as restrictions ease, experts have warned.

item.title: Surgeon struck off for sexually motivated misconduct after he repeatedly groped female colleagues
item.description: Dr Muhammad Khan, 55, would grope women at work and make smutty remarks about them in his native language during surgery at Barnsley District Hospital

item.title: Kanye West is 'REFUSING to see wife Kim Kardashian'
item.description: Following his shocking claim that the couple had planned to abort their eldest child and criticised activist Harriet Tubman - it's now been claimed he's had very little communication

item.title: Children's news website The Day apologises to JK Rowling after the author threatened legal action
item.description: The newspaper for British schoolchildren agreed to donate to a charity of JK Rowling's choice after publishing a story titled 'Potterheads cancel Rowling after trans tweet' on June 10.

item.title: Inside the time warp house where ex-Royal Navy sailor, 89, has left decor untouched since 1948
item.description: Doug Bethel, 89, from Liverpool, Merseyside, lives in the house he grew up in with his parents and six siblings and still has his childhood bedroom intact and the original kitchen and cooker.

item.title: Inside the glamorous lives of London's crazy rich Russians
item.description: Here FEMAIL uncovers the lives of some of the young Moscow-born UK educated elites who treat London as a big playground for parties and secret societies.

item.title: NASA captures summer on Saturn in an amazing new snapshot from the Hubble Space Telescope
item.description: Astronomers said that Saturn's rings - seen from a distance of 839 million miles from Earth - are so bright in the image that they look like 'freshly fallen snow'.

item.title: Parents who won battle to name their son LUCIFER says registrar compared name to Hitler
item.description: Dan and Mandy Sheldon, from Chesterfield, who won a battle to call their son Lucifer told on This Morning that their registrar compared the choice to naming their son after Adolf Hitler.

item.title: Labour demands licence review of Russian state-owned broadcaster RT
item.description: Labour has gone to the UK's broadcasting watchdog after Moscow was accused of a brazen plot to sway last year's general election campaign in former leader Jeremy Corbyn's favour.

item.title: North Korean ghost ships that wash up in Japan are aging fishing vessels
item.description: In 2017 more than 100 boats landed on the Japanese coast with 35 bodies on board and more have been found on beaches since according to Global Fishing Watch.

item.title: Otterly cute: Otter cuddles up to cat as the unlikely playmates go to sleep at their home in Japan
item.description: Sakura the otter and Mochi the cat were filmed falling asleep together at home. Adorable footage shot by owner Mako in Japan shows the three-year-old otter cuddling her feline friend.

item.title: You're hired! Avoid THESE CV buzzwords to boost your employability prospects
item.description: More than 500 hiring managers across several popular industries in the UK revealed to resume.io the commonly-used words on CVs that they most dislike seeing, including 'best'.

item.title: Shocking moment family stop to take photographs on tracks just minutes before train hurtles past
item.description: CCTV images shared by Network Rail show the family-of-four standing in the middle of the potentially deadly cut-through in Hutton, Essex, with a baseball-clad man seen lining up a picture.

item.title: Five bedroom Victorian house which featured on hit TV sitcom Outnumbered goes on the market
item.description: The Victorian-era property, which is located on Dempster Road in Wandsworth, South West London, is currently on sale with Prime Location for £1,795,000.

item.title: Winter flights to long haul destinations are down by 55%
item.description: Travellers can save hundreds of pounds on holidays to exotic locations such as Barbados, Phuket and the Maldives this year, when compared to last year, according to data from Skyscanner.

item.title: Harry and Meghan sue paparazzi over 'illegal' LA pictures of Archie
item.description: The lawsuit, filed in Superior Court of the State of California, County of Los Angeles, cited 'serial intrusions' of privacy of the couple's 14-month old child.

item.title: Social media users poke fun at fashion, farce and fury provoked by new face mask law
item.description: New rules forcing people in England wear face masks in shops came into force this morning - and social media users are already poking fun at the fashion, farce and fury.

item.title: Elton John's legal fight with ex-wife Renate could cost him MORE than £3million
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Renate Blauel has told lawyers she wants her existence as an unknown member of the public back and is determined go ahead with the bombshell High Court action to ensure she can.

item.title: Tony Blair warns that coronavirus cannot be eliminated and the UK must prepare for 'living with it'
item.description: The former prime minister said infrastructure to stop the spread of the virus was critical as another national lockdown would not be possible, suggesting that people instead need to learn to live safely with the virus.

item.title: Woman discovers Zara's size 12 jeans are SMALLER than a similar style from ASOS in an eight
item.description: Rebecca, from Leeds, was stunned to discover her size 12 jeans from Zara were smaller than a size eight pair from ASOS in a similar style and posted to Instagram to reassure others.

item.title: Eight death row prisoners among 15 inmates to die of coronavirus in California prison
item.description: San Quentin State Prison in California confirmed its eighth coronavirus death on death row on Tuesday as its outbreak worsens.

item.title: The cost of lockdown on Britain's economy 'is not worth the lives saved', study claims
item.description: The damage to the economy is an astonishing £70billion greater than the value of the years of life saved, when applying an NHS formula. Pictured: The first Saturday night in London after lockdown.

item.title: Leader of charity quits after labelling Jews 'grandchildren of monkeys and pigs'
item.description: Heshmat Khalifa , a former trustee and director of Islamic Relief Worldwide, said the Jews are 'grandchildren of monkeys and pigs'.
